availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, shoemaker. Native of Ireland. Married to Anastasia "Anna" Rawley. Father of Margaret Rawley, Michael Rawley, Mary A. Rawley, Agnes Rawley, Kate Rawley, Ellen "Nettie" Rawley, and John T. Rawley. Shoemaker in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, in 1852. Clerk in Ross County, Ohio, in 1860. Shoemaker in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Ross County, Chillicothe, p. 83.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 7, p. 18A, 312A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 124, p. 395D.
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1866), 126.
Robert W.S. Mackay, The Montreal Directory, (Montreal: John Lovell, 1852), p. 213.
"Thomas Rawley (1815-1902)," Find A Grave, Memorial 189689272, accessed December 1, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/189689272.
